member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Exceptions.CogDisplayZoomOutOfRangeException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when the zoom value goes out of its range. The Zoom property must be between 2^-16 and 2^+16.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogRenderEngineConstants
member.summary: Enumeration for the rendering engine used by the control.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogRenderEngineConstants.CogRenderEngine
member.summary: Uses Cognex Render Engine for drawing.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogRenderEngineConstants.CogGDIRenderEngine
member.summary: Uses GDI Render Engine for drawing.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplayMouseModeConstants
member.summary: Enumeration for mouse behavior modes.

remarks.para: Used in to select the mouse mode.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplayMouseModeConstants.Pan
member.summary: Specifies pan mode for the mouse. This mode is the easiest to pan images in.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplayMouseModeConstants.Pointer
member.summary: Specifies pointer mode for the mouse. This mode is for manipulating interactive graphics.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplayMouseModeConstants.UserDefined
member.summary: Specifies user mode for the mouse. This mode allows easiest user customization of mouse behavior.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplayMouseModeConstants.ZoomIn
member.summary: Specifies zoom in mode for the mouse. This mode allows easy left-click zooming in.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplayMouseModeConstants.ZoomOut
member.summary: Specifies zoom out mode for the mouse. This mode allows easy left-click zooming out.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplayMouseWheelModeConstants
member.summary: Enumeration for mouse wheel behavior modes.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplayMouseWheelModeConstants.None
member.summary: The mouse wheel is inactive.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplayMouseWheelModeConstants.Zoom1
member.summary: Specifies standard Zoom mode for the mouse wheel.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplayMouseWheelModeConstants.Zoom2
member.summary: Specifies a more refined Zoom mode which is better suited for use with MouseMode Pan.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplayScalingMethodConstants
member.summary: Enumeration used with to specify the zooming method to use.

remarks.para: Use to get or set the scaling method.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplayScalingMethodConstants.Continuous
member.summary: Specifies continuous scaling. The image is nearest neighbor sampled to scale to the exact value of the property.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplayScalingMethodConstants.ContinuousBilinear
member.summary: Specifies continuous scaling. Bilinear interpolation is used to scale to the exact value of the property.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplayScalingMethodConstants.Integer
member.summary: Specifies integer scaling. The image is scaled using the largest integer scale value smaller than the property.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplayContentBitmapConstants
member.summary: Enumeration for specifying format of display content bitmap.

remarks.para: Used in to specify the part of a display image to render as a bitmap.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplayContentBitmapConstants.Custom
member.summary: The content of the returned bitmap is determined by a passed content rectangle and bitmap size.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplayContentBitmapConstants.Display
member.summary: The returned bitmap contains exactly what is visible in the display. The image is scaled and panned as it currently appears in the display, and graphics annotations are clipped at the display boundaries.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplayContentBitmapConstants.Image
member.summary: The returned bitmap contains the full unscaled image with graphics annotations clipped at the image boundaries.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplayPanAnchorConstants
member.summary: Enumeration for method of specifying pan anchor.

remarks.para:
Used in , , , and
to get and set the pan anchors.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplayPanAnchorConstants.Absolute
member.summary: Indicates that the specified pan anchor is in absolute screen or image coordinates.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplayPanAnchorConstants.Relative
member.summary: Indicates that the specified pan anchor is relative to screen or image size.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplayZOrderConstants
member.summary: Enumeration for specifying z-order extents.

remarks.para: Used in to specify the search direction.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplayZOrderConstants.Front
member.summary: Specifies the front of the z-order.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplayZOrderConstants.Back
member.summary: Specifies the back of the z-order.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplayColorMapPredefinedConstants
member.summary: Enumeration for predefined colormaps

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplayColorMapPredefinedConstants.None
member.summary: Specifies no predefined colormap.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplayColorMapPredefinedConstants.Grey
member.summary: Specifies a linear grey predefined colormap.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplayColorMapPredefinedConstants.Thermal
member.summary: Specifies a thermal predefined colormap.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplayColorMapPredefinedConstants.Height
member.summary: Specifies a height predefined colormap.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplayColorMapPredefinedConstants.Custom
member.summary: Specifies a user defined colormap.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogStaticGraphicsContainer
member.summary: A container for the display's static graphics.

remarks.para:
Any graphic object that implements
that you
to this container is displayed.
Graphics added to this collection are static. You cannot change their location, color, or other attributes once they are added to the display. Use for movable, dynamic, or interactive graphics.
See Displaying an Image, Annotating an Image, and Drawing Graphics to learn more about drawing images and graphics in a display control.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogStaticGraphicsContainer.AddList(Cognex.VisionPro.CogGraphicCollection,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a list of static graphics to the display.
member.param: The list of static graphics to add to the display.
The name of the graphics group to which to add all of the .
member.exception: Thrown when the object is already disposed.
Thrown when any of the arguments are invalid.

remarks.para: Once added to the static graphics container, the graphics objects in the list cannot be changed.

The location properties and
of each graphic in the list determine where it is drawn.
If the display control cannot resolve a graphic's selected space name (as described in ) then the graphic is added without error to the collection until its space name is resolvable.
Set to false for better performance. However, if you add the same graphic to this container more than once, the behavior is undefined and errors may occur.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogStaticGraphicsContainer.Add(Cognex.VisionPro.ICogGraphic,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a static graphic to the display.
member.param: The static graphic to add to the display.
The name of the graphics group to which to add .
member.exception: Thrown when the object is already disposed.
Thrown when any of the arguments are invalid.

remarks.para: Once added to the static graphics container, the graphics object cannot be changed.

The graphic object's location properties and its
determine where the graphic is drawn.
If the display control cannot resolve the graphic's selected space name (as described in ) then the graphic is added without error to the collection until its space name is resolvable.
Set to false for better performance. However, if you add the same graphic to this container more than once, the behavior is undefined and errors may occur.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogStaticGraphicsContainer.MoveToFront(System.String)
member.summary: Moves the specified group to the front of the z-order.
member.param: The named group to move to the front of the z-order.
member.exception: Thrown when the object is already disposed.
Thrown when an illegal name of the group is used.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogStaticGraphicsContainer.MoveToBack(System.String)
member.summary: Moves the specified group to the back of the z-order.
member.param: The named group to move to the back of the z-order.
member.exception: Thrown when the object is already disposed.
Thrown when an illegal name of the group is used.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogStaticGraphicsContainer.MoveForward(System.String)
member.summary: Moves the specified group one group closer to the front of the z-order.
member.param: The named group to move one group closer to the front of the z-order.
member.exception: Thrown when the object is already disposed.
Thrown when an illegal name of the group is used.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogStaticGraphicsContainer.MoveBackward(System.String)
member.summary: Moves the specified group one step closer to the back of the z-order.
member.param: The named group to move to the back of the z-order.
member.exception: Thrown when the object is already disposed.
Thrown when an illegal name of the group is used.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogStaticGraphicsContainer.Clear
member.summary: Removes all static graphics from the display.
member.exception: Thrown when the object is already disposed.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogStaticGraphicsContainer.Remove(System.String)
member.summary: Removes all of the graphics in the specified group from the display.
member.param: The name of the graphics group to remove from the display.
member.exception: Thrown when the object is already disposed.
Thrown when an illegal name of the group is used.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogStaticGraphicsContainer.Dispose
member.summary: Dispose the control.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogStaticGraphicsContainer.ZOrderGroups
member.summary: Returns the z-order of the groups in this display.
member.value: The z-order for the groups in this display. The first string in the collection is the name of the group drawn first.
member.exception: Thrown when the object is already disposed.
Thrown when it fails to retrieve the return value--CogStringCollection.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogInteractiveGraphicsContainer
member.summary: Object that contains user's interactive graphics.

remarks.para:
Any graphic object that implements
that you
to this container is displayed.

Graphics that you add to this collection can be changed, moved, and manipulated interactively after being added to the display. If you add a graphic to this collection, then change its location or color, the graphic is updated immediately on the display
See Displaying an Image, Annotating an Image, and Drawing Graphics to learn more about drawing images and graphics in a display control.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogInteractiveGraphicsContainer.AddList(Cognex.VisionPro.CogGraphicInteractiveCollection,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a list of interactive graphics to the display.
member.param: The list of interactive graphics to add to the display.
The name of the graphics group to which to add all of the .
If true checks whether is already in the display container.
member.exception: Thrown when the object is already disposed.
Thrown when any of the arguments are invalid.

remarks.para:
The location properties and
of each graphic in the list determine where it is drawn.
If the display control cannot resolve a graphic's selected space name (as described in ) then the graphic is added without error to the collection until its space name is resolvable.
Set to false for better performance. However, if you add the same graphic to this container more than once, the behavior is undefined and errors may occur.

member.summary: Adds an interactive graphic to the display.
member.param: The interactive graphic to add to the display.
The name of the graphics group to which to add .
If true checks whether is already in the display container.
member.exception: Thrown when the object is already disposed.
Thrown when any of the arguments are invalid.

remarks.para:
The graphic object's location properties and its
determine where the graphic is drawn.
If the display control cannot resolve the graphic's selected space name (as described in ) then the graphic is added without error to the collection until its space name is resolvable.
Set to false for better performance. However, if you add the same graphic to this container more than once, the behavior is undefined and errors may occur.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogInteractiveGraphicsContainer.FindItem(System.Object,Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplayZOrderConstants)
member.summary: Finds the first matching item and returns its index.
member.param: The item to find or the name of a graphics group.
When is , the search starts at the front of the z-order. When is , the search starts at the end of the z-order.
member.returns: The index of the matching item, or -1 if no item was found.
member.exception: Thrown when the object is already disposed.
Thrown when any of the arguments are invalid.

remarks.para:
If is a group name,
returns the first item in the group when is and the last item in the group when is .

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay
member.summary: The display object that shows an image and static and interactive graphics.

remarks.para:
The Cognex Display control is an ActiveX control which displays images and graphics. You display images by setting the property to be the image you want to display. You display graphics by adding graphic objects to the
or
collections in a display.
See Displaying an Image, Annotating an Image, and Drawing Graphics to learn more about drawing images and graphics in a display control.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor

members.member: CR55371 was implemented using the .NET ContextMenuStrip and hiding the old OCX's ContextMenu

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.SetImage16GreyColorMap(System.Collections.ArrayList)
member.summary: Sets a colormap for 16-bit greyscale image display. The size of the colormap being set must match the type of 16-bit image being currently displayed (either 10, 12, 14, or 16-bit image) otherwise an exception is thrown. In order to change colormap sizes, remove any image being displayed.
member.value: An ArrayList containing 256, 1024, 4096, 16384, or 65536 System.Drawing.Color values.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.
Thrown when an invalid colormap is specified.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.GetImage16GreyColorMap
member.summary: Returns the colormap for 16-bit greyscale image display. If the user has not set a colormap for 16-bit greyscale images, then null is returned.
member.value: An ArrayList containing 256, 1024, 4096, 16384, or 65536 System.Drawing.Color values.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.ClearImage16GreyColorMap
member.summary: Clears the 16-bit greyscale colormap that has been set. This method does nothing if no 16-bit greyscale colormap has been set.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.SetImage16RangeColorMap(System.Collections.ArrayList)
member.summary: Sets a colormap for 16-bit range image display. The size of the colormap being set must match the type of 16-bit image being currently displayed (either 10, 12, 14, or 16-bit image) otherwise an exception is thrown. In order to change colormap sizes, remove any image being displayed.
member.value: An ArrayList containing 256, 1024, 4096, 16384, or 65536 System.Drawing.Color values.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.
Thrown when an invalid colormap is specified.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.GetImage16RangeColorMap
member.summary: Returns the colormap for 16-bit range image display. If the user has not set a colormap for 16-bit range images, then null is returned.
member.value: An ArrayList containing 256, 1024, 4096, 16384, or 65536 System.Drawing.Color values.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.ClearImage16RangeColorMap
member.summary: Clears the 16-bit range colormap that has been set. This method does nothing if no 16-bit range colormap has been set.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.SetColorMapRoiLimits(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the lower and upper limit of the colormap's range of interest expressed as a floating point number where 0.0 represents pixel value zero and 1.0 represents the max pixel value (which depends on the displayed image).
member.param: The lower limit. Valid values for this param is in the range of 0.0 to 1.0.
The upper limit. Valid values for this param is in the range of 0.0 to 1.0.
member.event: Fires when the property value is changed.
member.exception: Thrown if lower or upper limits are less than 0.0 or more than 1.0.
Thrown if the lower limit is greater than the upper limit.
Thrown when the display control is invalid.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.SetColorMapClipColors(System.Drawing.Color,System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Sets the lower and upper clip colors of the colormap range of interest.
member.param: The lower clip color.
The upper clip color.
member.event: Fires when the property value is changed.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.ColorMapLoad(System.String)
member.summary: Loads and sets a colormap from the specified file. This method can only be called if an image is being displayed.
member.param: Filename of the file that contains the colormap
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.
Thrown if no image is being displayed.
Thrown if a non 8-bit or 16-bit image is being displayed.
member.event: Fires when the colormap is loaded.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.ColorMapSave(System.String)
member.summary: Saves the currently set colormap to the specified file. This method can only be called if an image is being displayed.
member.param: Filename of the file that will contain the currently set colormap
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.
Thrown if no image is being displayed.
Thrown if a non 8-bit or non 16-bit image is being displayed.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.ColorMapToString
member.summary: Internal use only

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.ColorMapFromString(System.String)
member.summary: Internal use only

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.CreateContentBitmap(Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplayContentBitmapConstants,Cognex.VisionPro.CogRectangle,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the current content of the display (image and graphics) as a bitmap in a picture object.
member.param: The type of content bitmap to create.
The rectangle within the display to return as a bitmap.
The maximum dimension for the requested bitmap.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.
Thrown when one of the followings happen: BitmapSize is less than 0, if return bitmap cannot be allocated, or CogSpaceTree errors if passed content rect cannot be mapped to pixel(#) space.

remarks.para: The parameter specifies how the bitmap is created.

If you use as the parameter the and parameters specify which portion of the displayed image is used to create the bitmap. If is zero, the returned bitmap is the unscaled portion of the image that describes. If is not zero, it is used as the largest dimension of the resulting bitmap, and the bitmap has the same aspect ratio as .
If is and is zero, the returned bitmap is the unscaled contents of the display.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.GetImage8GreyColorMap(System.Byte)
member.summary: Returns the OLE_COLOR that is mapped to a grey scale pixel value.
member.param: The grey pixel value.
member.returns: The OLE_COLOR mapped to the grey value.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.
Thrown when the passed color is not a valid OLE_COLOR

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.GetImage8GreyColorMap
member.summary: Returns the colormap for 8-bit greyscale image display.
member.value: An ArrayList containing 256 System.Drawing.Color values.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.SetImage8GreyColorMap(System.Byte,Cognex.VisionPro.CogColorConstants)
member.summary: Maps a grey scale pixel value to an OLE_COLOR.
member.param: The grey pixel value to map for display.
An OLE_COLOR to display instead of the grey pixel value.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.
Thrown when the passed color is not a valid OLE_COLOR

remarks.para: All pixels in the image whose grey scale value is are displayed with the color .

example.code:
Private Sub AcquireButton_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles AcquireButton.Click Dim trignum As Integer Dim i as Integer
' Display pixel values below 50 in dark red For i = 0 To 50 cogDisplay1.SetImage8GreyColorMap(i, CogColorConstants.DarkRed) Next
cogDisplay1.Image = mAcqFifo.Acquire(trignum) cogDisplay1.Fit(True) numAcqs += 1
If numAcqs > 4 Then GC.Collect() numAcqs = 0 End If End Sub

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.SetImage8GreyColorMap(System.Collections.ArrayList)
member.summary: Sets a colormap for 8-bit greyscale image display. The size of the colormap must be 256.
member.value: An ArrayList containing 256 System.Drawing.Color values.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.
Thrown when an invalid colormap is specified.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.ClearImage8GreyColorMap
member.summary: Clears the 8-bit greyscale colormap that has been set.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.GetTransform(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the transform from to .
member.param: The destination space.
The source space.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.

remarks.para: lets you transform locations between the display's coordinate spaces and screen coordinates (which have the special name "*").
The values that you specify for and must be one of the following:

item.description: a named space in the image being displayed (including "." and "@")

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.QueryRenderCaps(System.String)
member.summary: Queries the rendering engine for any special capabilities it might have.
member.param: Queries for an interface that will allow them to tweak new features or disable them if they don't like them.
member.returns: An interface to the new rendering engine capability. Returns null if the engine does not support the new capability.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.SetImagePanAnchor(System.Double,System.Double,Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplayPanAnchorConstants)
member.summary: Sets the image pan anchor position.
member.param: The x-coordinate of the pan anchor.
The y-coordinate of the pan anchor.
How the pan distance is computed.
member.event: Fires when the image pan anchor point changes.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.

remarks.para:
The image pan anchor is the center of the display control's display area for the purposes of image panning. When you specify a value for
or
you are specifying a distance between the image pan anchor point and the screen pan anchor point.
When is , the values of and are in the range 0.0 to 1.0. The point (0,0) is the top left of the display and the point (1,1) is the bottom right of the display.
When is , the values of and are absolute coordinate values.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.GetImagePanAnchor(System.Double@,System.Double@,Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplayPanAnchorConstants@)
member.summary: Returns the image pan anchor position.

The y-coordinate of the pan anchor.
How the pan distance is computed.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.

remarks.para:
The image pan anchor is the center of the display control's display area for the purposes of image panning. When you specify a value for
or
you are specifying a distance between the image pan anchor point and the screen pan anchor point.
When is , the values of and are in the range 0.0 to 1.0. The point (0,0) is the top left of the display and the point (1,1) is the bottom right of the display.
When is , the values of and are absolute coordinate values.

or
you are specifying a distance between the image pan anchor point and the screen pan anchor point.
When is , the values of and are in the range 0.0 to 1.0. The point (0,0) is the top left of the display and the point (1,1) is the bottom right of the display.
When is , the values of and are absolute coordinate values.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.GetScreenPanAnchor(System.Double@,System.Double@,Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplayPanAnchorConstants@)
member.summary: Returns the screen pan anchor position.

The y-coordinate of the pan anchor.

The image pan anchor is the center of the display control's display area for the purposes of image panning. When you specify a value for
or
you are specifying a distance between the image pan anchor point and the screen pan anchor point.
When is , the values of and are in the range 0.0 to 1.0. The point (0,0) is the top left of the display and the point (1,1) is the bottom right of the display.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.StopLiveDisplay
member.summary: Stops live image display.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.

remarks.para: If the display is not currently displaying live video, this function has no effect.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.StartLiveDisplay(System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Starts live image display using the specified acquisition FIFO.
member.param: The image source. Must implement .
If true, this method optimizes display performance, but there are some resitrctions on how you can use the FIFO.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.

remarks.para:
If is true,
optimizes display performance, but you should not attempt to use to acquire images while live video is running.

If 's
is , must be true.
See Acquiring from a Live Display to learn how to acquire images while displaying live video.

example.code:
Imports Cognex.VisionPro
Private myFrameGrabbers As CogFrameGrabbers Private myFrameGrabber As Cognex.VisionPro.ICogFrameGrabber Private myAcqFifo As Cognex.VisionPro.ICogAcqFifo
Private Sub AcquireDisplay() Const VIDEO_FORMAT = "Sony XC75 640x480" Dim tNum As Integer
myFrameGrabbers = New CogFrameGrabbers myFrameGrabber = myFrameGrabbers.Item(0) myAcqFifo = myFrameGrabber.CreateAcqFifo(VIDEO_FORMAT, CogAcqFifoPixelFormatConstants.Format8Grey, 0, False)
cogDisplay1.StartLiveDisplay(myAcqFifo, False); End Sub

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.Fit(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Uses the current
to find the largest zoom value that allows the entire image to be visible in the display.
member.param: If true, the image is scaled and panned so that all graphics are visible too. This parameter is ignored if there are no graphics or if the graphics all lie within the bounds of the image.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.

remarks.para: sets the scale and pan values so that the entire image is visible in the display. If there are graphics outside the area of the image and is true, the image is scaled and panned so that the image and graphics are visible.

example.code:
Private Sub AcquireButton_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles AcquireButton.Click Dim trignum As Integer
cogDisplay1.Image = mAcqFifo.Acquire(trignum) cogDisplay1.Fit(True) numAcqs += 1
If numAcqs > 4 Then GC.Collect() numAcqs = 0 End If End Sub

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.BackColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the background color of the display.
member.value: The background color.

remarks.para: The background color appears between the borders of the image and the borders of the display control window. If there is no image in the window, this color completely fills the window.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.ColorMapPredefined
member.summary: Gets or sets the predefined colormap on this display object.
member.value: The predefined colormap. Default is CogDisplayColormapPredefinedConstants.None
member.event: Fires when the property value is changed.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.ColorMapLowerRoiLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the lower limit of the colormap's range of interest expressed as a floating point number where 0.0 represents pixel value zero and 1.0 represents the max pixel value (which depends on the displayed image).
member.value: The lower limit. Default value is 0.0. Valid values for this property are in the range of 0.0 to 1.0.
member.event: Fires when the property value is changed.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.
Thrown if value is less than 0.0 or more than 1.0.
Thrown if value is greater than ColorMapUpperRoiLimit.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.ColorMapUpperRoiLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the upper limit of the colormap's range of interest expressed as a floating point number where 0.0 represents pixel value zero and 1.0 represents the max pixel value (which depends on the displayed image).
member.value: The upper limit. Default value is 1.0. Valid values for this property are in the range of 0.0 to 1.0.
member.event: Fires when the property value is changed.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.
Thrown if value is less than 0.0 or more than 1.0.
Thrown if value is less than ColorMapLowerRoiLimit.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.ColorMapLowerClipColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the lower clip color of the colormap. This property is only valid if an image is being displayed and ColorMapPredefined is not None or Custom.
member.value: The lower clip color. Default is Color.Black.
member.event: Fires when the property value is changed.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.ColorMapUpperClipColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the upper clip color of the colormap. This property is only valid if an image is being displayed and ColorMapPredefined is not None or Custom.
member.value: The upper clip color. Default is Color.Black.
member.event: Fires when the property value is changed.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.Image
member.summary: Gets or sets the image currently in the display.
member.value: The image in the display.
member.remarks: When displaying images of different types and a colormap is set, you may have to call one of the colormap properties with a new value in order to update the internal colormap.
member.event: Fires when an image is changed
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.

remarks.para: To display an image, set this property to the image to display.
Setting this property to causes the display to release its current image reference and to fill the display window with the background color.

example.code:
Private Sub AcquireButton_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles AcquireButton.Click Dim trignum As Integer
cogDisplay1.Image = mAcqFifo.Acquire(trignum) cogDisplay1.Fit(True) numAcqs += 1
If numAcqs > 4 Then GC.Collect() numAcqs = 0 End If End Sub

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.HorizontalScrollBar
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the horizontal scroll bar is visible.
member.value: True if the horizontal scroll bar is visible.
member.event: Fires when the property value is changed.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.

remarks.para: If scroll bars are not visible, the user may still be able to pan the image using the pan mouse mode.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.VerticalScrollBar
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the vertical scroll bar is visible.
member.value: True if the vertical scroll bar is visible.
member.event: Fires when the property value is changed.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.

remarks.para: If scroll bars are not visible, the user may still be able to pan the image using the pan mouse mode.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.PopupMenu
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the user can right-click to bring up a pop-up menu that controls the behavior of the display.
member.value: True if the user can right-click to bring up the pop-up menu.
member.event: Fires when the property value is changed.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.

remarks.para: The user can use the pop-up menu, shown below, to change the mouse mode, turn grid lines on and off, fit the image, and reset the Zoom to 1.0

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.PanX
member.summary: Gets or sets the x-position of the image in the display.
member.value: The x-position of the image in the display.
member.event: Fires when the property value is changed.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.

remarks.para: The value is the distance, in image coordinates, between the image pan anchor and the screen pan anchor. A positive value means that the image anchor point is to the right of the screen anchor; a negative value means that it is to the left.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.PanY
member.summary: Gets or sets the y-position of image in the display.
member.value: The y-position of image in the display.
member.event: Fires when the property value is changed.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.

remarks.para: The value is the distance, in image coordinates, between the image pan anchor and the screen pan anchor. A positive value means that the image anchor point is below the screen anchor; a negative value means that it is above.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.Zoom
member.summary: Gets or sets the scale value used to display the image and graphics.
member.value: The scale value used to display the image and graphics.
member.event: Fires when the property value is changed.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.

remarks.para: The actual scale value used depends on the property, which may truncate the value to the nearest smaller integer

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.ScalingMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets the scaling method the display control uses when zooming.
member.value: The scaling method.
member.event: Fires when the property value is changed.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.

remarks.para: Images can be scaled by integer factors or by floating point factors. Integer factors are often faster.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.DrawingEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether drawing takes place.
member.value: True if drawing takes place.
member.event: Fires when the property value is changed.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.

remarks.para: When this property is true (the default), then all methods and properties that would change the appearance of a display are rendered immediately.

If you are constructing a complex graphic display using many individual graphic objects, you can improve performance by disabling drawing, adding all the graphics, then enabling drawing. When you re-enable drawing, all rendering is performed.
Note that setting this property to false also disables any updates to the display of the image, so changes to pan or zoom values will not appear until after drawing is re-enabled

example.code:
Private Sub doDraw() Dim mCircle As New CogCircle Dim mRect As New CogRectangle
cogDisplay1.DrawingEnabled = False cogDisplay1.InteractiveGraphics.Add(mCircle, "Circle", False) cogDisplay1.InteractiveGraphics.Add(mRect, "Rect", False)
mCircle.CenterX = cogDisplay1.Image.Width / 2 mCircle.CenterY = cogDisplay1.Image.Height / 2 mCircle.Radius = cogDisplay1.Image.Height / 4 mRect.SetCenterWidthHeight(mCircle.CenterX, mCircle.CenterY, cogDisplay1.Image.Width / 2, cogDisplay1.Image.Height / 2)
cogDisplay1.DrawingEnabled = True End Sub

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.MouseMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the behavior of the display control in response to mouse input.
member.value: The mouse mode behavior.
member.event: Fires when the property value is changed.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.

remarks.para: The display has four different mouse behavior modes:

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.MouseWheelMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the behavior of the display control in response to mouse wheel input.
member.value: The mouse wheel mode behavior. Default is CogDisplayMouseWheelModeConstants.Zoom1
member.event: Fires when the property value is changed.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.MouseWheelSensitivity
member.summary: Gets or sets the sensitivity of the mouse wheel when zooming in the display.
member.value: The mouse wheel sensititivity, default value is 1.0. The mouse wheel sensitivity cannot be less than 0.
member.exception: Thrown if value is less than 0
member.event: Fires when the property value is changed.
member.remarks:
Useful mouse wheel sensitivity values will likely be in the range 0.5 to 1.5. Setting the mouse wheel sensitivity 0 will effectivly disable zooming via the mouse wheel. Setting mouse wheel sensitivity to a value that is too high may also disable zooming via the mouse wheel.
MouseWheelSensitivity is ignored if MouseWheelMode is None

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.LiveDisplayRunning
member.summary: Returns true if live image display is active.
member.value: True if live image display is active.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.

member.value: The minimum value.
member.event: Fires whenever the value is changed
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.

member.summary: Returns the maximum value.

member.event: Fires whenever the value is changed

member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.

member.value: The maximum value.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.RenderEngine
member.summary: Gets or sets the rendering engine used to draw the contents of the display.
member.value: The rendering engine.
member.event: Fires when the value is changed
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.UserDisplayTree
member.summary: Returns a coordinate space tree containing coordinate spaces associated with this display control.
member.value: The coordinate space tree.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.

remarks.para: The root space for this tree is the screen pixels used by this display control, with the origin in the upper-left corner, the positive x-axis extending to the right, and the positive y-axis extending down. You can use this coordinate space tree to make it easier to create display annotations that are independent of the image being displayed in the control and independent of any display zoom or pan.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.UserPixelTree
member.summary: Returns a coordinate space tree containing coordinate spaces associated with this display control.
member.value: The coordinate space tree.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.

remarks.para: The root space for this tree is the screen pixels used by this display control, with the origin in the upper-left corner, the positive x-axis extending to the right, and the positive y-axis extending down. You can use this coordinate space tree to make it easier to create display annotations that are independent of the image being displayed in the control. Unlike the space, this space reflects the effect of any pan and zoom settings for the display.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.GridEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the pixel grid is visible.
member.value: True if the pixel grid is visible.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.

remarks.para: The pixel grid is visible when is greater than or equal to 64.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.GridColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the pixel grid lines.
member.value: The color of the pixel grid lines.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.SubPixelGridEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the sub-pixel grid is visible.
member.value: True if the sub-pixel grid is visible.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.

remarks.para: The sub-pixel grid is visible when is greater than or equal to 128.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.SubPixelGridColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the sub-pixel grid lines.
member.value: The color of the sub-pixel grid lines.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.StaticGraphics
member.summary: Gets the static graphics container that contains the static graphics in this display.
member.value: The static graphics container.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.

remarks.para: You can add graphics to this collection to display them.

example.code:
Private Sub doDraw() Dim mCircle As New CogCircle
mCircle.CenterX = 100 mCircle.CenterY = 100 mCircle.Radius = 75
cogDisplay1.StaticGraphics.Add(mCircle, "Circle") End Sub

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.InteractiveGraphics
member.summary: Gets the interactive graphics container that contains the interactive graphics in this display.
member.value: The interactive graphics container.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.

remarks.para: You can add interactive graphics to this collection to display them.

example.code:
Private Sub doDraw() Dim mCircle As New CogCircle
mCircle.CenterX = 100 mCircle.CenterY = 100 mCircle.Radius = 75 mCircle.Interactive = True mCircle.GraphicDOFEnable = CogCircleDOFConstants.All
cogDisplay1.InteractiveGraphics.Add(mCircle, "Circle", False) End Sub

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.TouchDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the touch distance in pixels.
member.value: The touch distance.
member.exception: Thrown when the value is less than 1.
Thrown when the display control is invalid.

remarks.para: The touch distance is the minimum number of pixels within which the mouse must be from an interactive graphic to be considered touching the graphic.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.InteractiveGraphicTipsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether tool tips are displayed when the mouse is held over an interactive graphic.
member.value: True if tool tips are displayed when the mouse is held over an interactive graphic.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.

remarks.para: Use the graphic's property to set its tool tip text.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.MultiSelectionEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the user can select more than one interactive shape in the display.
member.value: True if multiple selection is enabled.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.

remarks.para: If enabled, the user may select more than one shape by holding down the Control key while selecting.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.LostAndFound
member.summary: Gets the graphics that could not be rendered in the display.
member.value: The graphics that could not be rendered in the display.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.

remarks.para: The interactive and static graphics in the lost-and-found list are those whose space name could not be resolved by the display control.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.Selection
member.summary: Returns the collection of currently selected interactive shapes in the display.
member.value: The collection of selected interactive shapes.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.AttentionGraphic
member.summary: Returns the interactive graphic the mouse is currently over.
member.value: The interactive graphic or if the mouse is not over an graphic.
member.event: Fires when the selection is made.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.

remarks.para: The mouse is considered over interactive graphic if it is within pixels of the graphic.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the display is enabled.
member.value: True if the display is enabled.
member.event: Fires when the value is changed.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.

remarks.para: When the display control is disabled, it does not respond to mouse events.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.AutoFit
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the image is resized to fit whenever the size of the control changes.
member.value: True if the image is resized when the control size changes.
member.event: Fires when the value is changed.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.UserDefinedMouseCursor
member.summary: Gets or sets the cursor that will be displayed whenever the MouseMode property is set to 'UserDefined'.
member.value: The user-defined mouse cursor or . If null, a standard arrow cursor will be displayed in UserDefined mode.
member.event: Fires when the value is changed.
member.exception: Thrown when the display control is invalid.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.VisiblePixelMaskEnable
member.summary: Whether the visible pixel mask is displayed to the user or not.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Display.CogDisplay.VisiblePixelMaskColor
member.summary: The fill color of the visible pixel mask.
